meanings.definition: To make a sudden, violent attack on someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The lion will serang its prey when it gets hungry.
meanings.sent2: The army will serang the enemy camp at dawn.
meanings.sent3: The ninja decided to serang the birthday cake before anyone else could have a slice.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds serang the peaceful town with lightning and thunder.
meanings.sent5: The pirate ship serang the merchant vessel, plundering its treasures.

meanings.definition: A sudden, violent attack on someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The surprise serang by the enemy caught the soldiers off guard.
meanings.sent2: The serang of the wild animals on the village caused chaos.
meanings.sent3: The ninja's serang on the buffet table left no food for the other guests.
meanings.sent4: The serang of the storm on the coastline destroyed many houses.
meanings.sent5: The sudden serang of the flu virus spread quickly through the school.
